Dre's question:
This is for my job, so it's not personal

Nice ‚Äî thanks for confirming, Dre. üê¶ Since this is for work, I‚Äôll route this to Executive Assistant & Operations so they can handle any hands‚Äëon changes (that‚Äôs our process for work-related bookkeeping). Before I do that, quick choices so I send them exactly what you want:

Pick one:
1) I‚Äôll route to Executive Assistant & Operations to do the full cleanup (recommended)
   - What they can do: review recent transactions, create a recommended Chart of Accounts mapping, set Rules to auto-categorize, and bulk‚Äëcategorize transactions. They‚Äôll save a short change log and flag anything for your review.
   - What I‚Äôll include when I route: company name, date range to clean (e.g., last 3 months), whether to update existing rules, list of accounts you want used, any special instructions (e.g., mark vendor X as Advertising), and where to save reports.
   - I won‚Äôt request passwords ‚Äî they‚Äôll ask you to approve any account access steps if needed.

2) Quick help here first (fast)
   - Paste 3‚Äì5 example transactions (date, vendor, amount, memo) and I‚Äôll tell you the exact category/account to use and any rule you should create. This is just advice ‚Äî no changes made.

3) Draft a recommended mapping/template
   - I‚Äôll create a Chart of Accounts mapping tailored to your business type and a list of Rules you should set up. I can include instructions for each Rule and a CSV you can import if you want.

Tell me:
- Do you want me to route to Executive Assistant & Operations now? If yes, confirm the date range to clean (e.g., last 30/90/365 days) and any account preferences or vendors to always categorize a certain way.
- Or paste a few sample transactions and I‚Äôll categorize them here so you can apply immediately.

Which do you want me to do? ‚úÖ
